meanings.definition: Relating to or caused by domoic acid.
meanings.sent1: The domoic reaction in the body can be harmful.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the domoic effects on the brain.
meanings.sent3: The domoic warning signs were clear to everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a domoic impact on his emotions.
meanings.sent5: The domoic symptoms were hard to ignore.

meanings.definition: A type of acid found in certain algae.
meanings.sent1: The ocean water contained traces of domoic.
meanings.sent2: The researchers discovered a new species of algae producing domoic.
meanings.sent3: The chef used domoic in the recipe, unaware of its dangers.
meanings.sent4: The domoic levels in the algae were unusually high this season.
meanings.sent5: The presence of domoic in the water was a concern for marine life.

meanings.definition: A substance that can cause amnesic shellfish poisoning.
meanings.sent1: The health department issued a warning about domoic in shellfish.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen were cautious of harvesting shellfish in domoic-infested waters.
meanings.sent3: The detective suspected foul play involving domoic in the shellfish.
meanings.sent4: The domoic outbreak led to a temporary ban on shellfish consumption.
meanings.sent5: The effects of domoic poisoning were evident in the affected individuals.
